page.title: 18Parish Meetings in Pembury
page.content: {Matters arising at Pembury Parish {Meeting, held in March, 1985.} The Parish Meetings in Pembury are regular. About 30 people attended this one along with some officers from Tunbridge Wells Borough Council and a representative of Kent Constabulary, who gave a talk on the neighbourhood watch scheme to help stop{crime. } There were questions put forward by locals concerning the availability of {rubbish}skips and the removal of full ones. Concern was expressed by parishioners that when the by pass is built that people will seek{permission {to build}on land. Those present wanted this resisted. The parishioners also complained about the{state of {pavements}during the icy winter. It was made clear that attention was on the roads, and it was up to residents to clear their own paths.
